content: The following lists events that happened during **1982 in Singapore**. ## Incumbents - [President](/wiki/President_of_Singapore): [C.V. Devan Nair](/wiki/C.V._Devan_Nair) - [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore): [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) ## Events ### January - 1 January – The [time zone](/wiki/Singapore_Standard_Time) in Singapore has changed to UTC+08:00 and it has not changed since. - 2 January – The [metric system](/wiki/Metric_unit) of weights and measures is introduced, replacing the [Imperial units](/wiki/Imperial_units). ### February - 23 February – The [Sentosa Monorail](/wiki/Sentosa_Monorail) is opened, making travelling convenient for visitors. ### March - 20–24 March - The first Festival of Dance (which was the early form of the current Singapore Arts Festival) was held at Victoria Theatre. ### May - 14 May – [Singa the Lion](/wiki/Singa_the_Lion) is unveiled as the National Courtesy Campaign's mascot, being launched two weeks later. - 28 May – The Government allows the building of the [Mass Rapid Transit](/wiki/Mass_Rapid_Transit_(Singapore)) after a 10-year debate. The first lines to be constructed are the [North South MRT line](/wiki/North_South_MRT_line) and the [East West MRT line](/wiki/East_West_MRT_line), scheduled for 1984. To fund the MRT, money earned from land plots in [Marina Bay](/wiki/Marina_Bay,_Singapore) will be used. ### June - 11 June – The [Sentosa Musical Fountain](/wiki/Sentosa_Musical_Fountain) is officially opened. It ran for 25 years until its closure in 2007. ### July - 1 July – New Nation newspaper is replaced by Singapore Monitor. - 25 July – The first locally produced drama, [Seletar Robbery](/wiki/Seletar_Robbery), is shown on [SBC 8](/wiki/Channel_8_(Singapore)). ### October - 1 October – The Postal Services Department merges into the Telecommunication Authority of Singapore, giving better services. ### November - 6 November – The National Civil Defence Plan was launched, setting guidelines for emergency preparations. ### Date unknown - [Ang Peng Siong](/wiki/Ang_Peng_Siong) was ranked world's No.1 in 1982 for clocking 22.69s in the 50m freestyle during the US Nationals and was named the World's Fastest Swimmer for 1982 by Swimming World magazine. ## Births - 24 January – [Fiona Xie](/wiki/Fiona_Xie), actress. - 2 June – [Jonathan Leong](/wiki/Jonathan_Leong), singer, runner-up of [Singapore Idol (Season 2)](/wiki/Singapore_Idol#Season_2_(2006)). - 7 September – [Race Wong](/wiki/Race_Wong), former singer and [2R](/wiki/2R_(group)) member, entrepreneur and co-founder of Ohmyhome. ## Deaths - 9 February – R. A. Hamid, trade union activist (b. 1922/1923). - 17 February – Seah Peng Chuan, former legislative assemblyman for [Kampong Kapor Constituency](/wiki/Kampong_Kapor_Constituency) (b. 1914). - 22 June – [Lancelot Maurice Pennefather](/wiki/Lancelot_Maurice_Pennefather), famous sportsman (b. 1894). - 29 October – [Lim Yong Liang](/wiki/Lim_Yong_Liang), Singaporean footballer (b. 1900). - 8 December – [H. J. C. Kulasingha](/wiki/H._J._C._Kulasingha), former legislative councillor for [Bukit Timah Constituency](/wiki/Bukit_Timah_SMC) (b. 1900). This Singapore-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: 1982 in Singapore
